Context: Ontario's Better Jobs Ontario program offers up to $28,000 in financial support for tuition, living expenses, and other costs for eligible applicants. This includes Ontario residents who have been unemployed for six months or more, laid-off workers, and gig workers. The program focuses on training programs that take 52 weeks or less to complete, including micro-credentials. Eligible programs may be found in Arts, Design & Information Technology, Construction & Engineering Technologies, Health Sciences, Hospitality & Culinary Arts, Community Services & Early Childhood, Business, and Continuing Education. Continuing Education certificates are typically covered for tuition and book/materials costs by the Ministry of Labour, Immigration, Training and Skills Development, but not living expenses. To be eligible, certificate programs must be completable in less than 1-year (52-weeks). Some examples of programs offered at George Brown College that may qualify include those in Arts, Design & Information Technology, Construction & Engineering Technologies, Health Sciences, Hospitality & Tourism Management, Community Services & Early Childhood, and Business.

Context:
The text provides information about the Continuing Education certificates offered by the college, which can be found on the ConEd website. It also mentions the Better Jobs Ontario program, an Ontario government grant that helps laid-off workers and individuals facing barriers to employment receive financial support while upgrading or gaining new skills in high-demand occupations in Ontario. Eligible applicants can receive financial help with tuition, books and supplies, transportation, and living expenses associated with their education.

To find out if you are eligible to apply for Better Jobs Ontario funding, you need to visit an Employment Ontario Centre. The nearest centre can be found on the Find Employment & Training Services website. The text also provides contact information for George Brown College: 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559, as well as an email address (ask.george@georgebrown.ca). The text encourages visitors to sign up for updates about application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more.

The text also includes a land acknowledgment reminder and a statement that the information on the website is subject to change without notice. It should not be viewed as a representation, offer, or warranty, and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
